title: Bender 0.24.0
Add flags to get sources and scripts for a subset of packages
body: Allows the user to individually specify which packages to include, exclude, and to remove all dependencies from the sources and scripts command. Default behavior (i.e. without the new flags) remains unchanged.

title: Add arguments to manage git fetching
body:
- `bender update --fetch` forces a re-fetch of the git dependencies
- `bender --local` disables fetching of remote repositories to avoid internet access

title: Add dependency information to sources command
body: This allows the dependency information available within bender to be accessed externally, in case this custom access is needed.

title: Add warning for name mismatch of dependency and package
body: A naming mismatch can currently cause issues, e.g. when using the parents command to identify packages. May be changed to an error in the future to enforce correct behavior.

title: Add correct base path to path dependencies in git
body: If a git dependency itself contains path dependencies, these should be linked relative to the git dependency, not anything else.

title: Improve git handling for issue (#52)
body:
- Add hint for workaround in issue (#52)
- Change method to get git commit hash from tag (use `git show-ref --dereference` instead of `git rev-parse
--verify HASH^{commit}`). Reduces number of concurrent commands to improve situation for (#52).

title: CI: Release for all currently supported Ubuntu versions
body:
Drop support for 16.04 LTS and 20.10, both of which have reached EOL, and add 21.04 and 21.10.

Closes #56.

title: Update links in README.md to PULP-platform
Add error handling on dependency mismatch (#60)
body: After updating `Bender.yml` with a new dependency not in `Bender.lock`, an error will be returned suggesting to run `bender update` instead of bender panicking without indication what the problem is.

title: CI improve
body:
Update CI tests:
- do not cancel jobs if one fails
- Update minimum Rust version to 1.46.0 (due to `bitflags` dependency)
- Properly name tests

title: Wrap defines in quotes for the VCS's shell script
body: Since VCS generates a shell script, we have to wrap the defines in quotes for this case to allow defines like `32'h80000000`. Otherwise, the `'` breaks the shell script.

title: Update Cargo manifest
Add error on cyclic dependencies to avoid infinite loop
body: Currently, if a dependency calls itself (or a different dependency subsequently calling itself, or further chains), this creates a dependency loop and results in an infinite loop within bender. This PR returns an error if cyclical dependencies are detected, with hints where to find the issue.

title: Add script for Mentor Precision
body:
This adds the feature to generate scripts for adding files to Mentor's Precision RTL synthesis tool.

Also this is the first time that I wrote something rust. So feel free to correct this if I made some obvious mistakes / broke the cargo dependencies.

title: Update CI to github actions
Performance
body:
Improve `bender update` performance for large projects with multiple git repositories, as referenced in #50.

Changes:
- resolver only uses one Core and SessionIo that is passed to subfunctions
- git_versions call uses a HashMap to fetch versions instead of repeatedly executing git calls in case multiple repositories reference a single dependency

title: Update parents command
body: Add version requirement print to `parents` command to fix #45, minor formatting changes

title: Fix tests on recent Git versions
body:
Recent versions of Git default to `main` as default branch name.  This causes the `iss5` test to fail.  This PR fixes this in a backwards-compatible way.

Additionally, `rev` in the `iss2` test is updated to use `main` as default branch name.

title: Added `clone` and `parents` command for improved workflow
body:
Added `clone` command to copy a git dependency to a workable location, adding a path override to Bender.local.
Added `parents` command to list packages calling a specified package.

title: Force git fetch on unsatisfied requirements to catch newly added tags
body:
When updating the version tag in a Bender.yml file to a newly created github tag, bender complains that it cannot satisfy the requirement, likely as it hasn't fetched from the github repository since the tag was added. This should force one fetch of the repo if the requirement cannot be satisfied, leaving all other behavior identical.

I am not that familiar with rust, please let me know if modifications are needed.

title: Bugfix: plugins work for scripts in the root repository
body: While attempting to use plugin scripts with bender, I noticed that plugins defined in the main repository's bender file would not be found. I believe this fixes the issue, albeit not very cleanly (first time using rust).

title: Extend Bender availability
body:
- Add table of contents to ReadMe.
- Add an *Installation* section, which describes three alternative methods to obtain Bender, to the ReadMe.
- Extend automatic builds to Ubuntu and more versions of CentOS.

For the first installation method to work, GitHub pages on this repository needs to be activated on the `website` branch.

title: Update CI
body:
- Increase minimum `rustc` version to 1.44.
- Build for additional CentOS versions.

title: Add command line argument for defines
body: Add a flag (`--defines`) which allows giving additional defines through the command line

title: cli: Also look for Bender.local recursively
body:
Bender would only check for a Bender.local in the root of the project
but fail to find any other `Bender.local`s on different hierarchy
levels. It now looks for `Bender.local` and `.bender.yml`.

title: update readme for Riviera
body:
Hey!
In this pull request I added information about Riviera-PRO in readme. Should I create also `bender-riviera plugin` like is in other tools?

title: common compilation for Riviera-PRO
body:
Hey!
In this pull request I added support for common compilation in Riviera-PRO. This compilation mode will be used as default and to change mode we need to type `--compilation_mode=separate`

title: version for Riviera PRO
body:
Hey!
In this pull request I added support for Riviera PRO

title: script: Add `flist` target for plain file lists
body: This creates a plain file list. No defines, simple includes no file groups. At the moment we need this for the OpenPiton file list in Ariane (https://github.com/pulp-platform/ariane/pull/393).

title: Feature/genus synthesis
body:
Implementation of Cadence Genus synthesis script output 
Start of verilator output for ASIC target lint

title: script: Add `vivado-sim` format
body:
Closes #23.

### Added
- Add `vivado-sim` format to the script command.  This format differs from the `vivado` format in that it targets simulation, not synthesis; other than that, it is equivalent to the `vivado` format.

title: Improve `script`
body:
Closes #22.

### Changed
- `script vivado` now emits paths relative to the project root with the `ROOT` variable.

### Fixed
- `script vcs`: Fix shell syntax to define `ROOT` variable.

title: Add support for VCS
body:
Adds a `vcs` format to create the compilation script for Synopsys VCS.
Additionally, it adds two options that can only be used with VCS:
- `--vlogan-bin` to specify the binary for analyzing Verilog files
- `--vhdlan-bin` to specify the binary for analyzing VHDL files

TODO:
- [x]  Test Verilog commands
- [ ]  Test VHDL commands
- [ ] CI?

title: Improve `script vivado`
Use `slice::iter` instead of `into_iter` to avoid future breakage
body:
`an_array.into_iter()` currently just works because of the autoref
feature, which then calls `<[T] as IntoIterator>::into_iter`. But
in the future, arrays will implement `IntoIterator`, too. In order
to avoid problems in the future, the call is replaced by `iter()`
which is shorter and more explicit.

A crater run showed that your crate is affected by a potential future 
change. See https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/65819 for more information.

title: Add repository information to Cargo.toml
body:
I found this project through crates.io. But there is not link to this repository.
I think the link is useful.

title: script: Add `--abort-on-error` flag
body: This flag causes compilation/analysis scripts to abort on errors that can be caught with Tcl's `catch`.

title: Add `script vivado`
body:
This adds an initial implementation for `bender script vivado`, which outputs commands to add all source files, set all include directories for all files, and set all defines for all files.

This is a very coarse-grained method, but in Vivado the only way to set include directories and defines on a *subset* of files would be to define multiple filesets, which leads to out-of-context synthesis in Vivado, which is not always desirable. We may later add an option to `script vivado` that allows to do this.

I validated the resulting commands in Vivado 2018.3.

title: CI: Build deploy products with stable Rust
script: Define format-specific targets even if no target is defined
body:
Emit format-specific target defines even if no target is specified.

Previously, `bender script <format>` would emit target-specific (e.g., `'TARGET_SYNTHESIS`) `define`s only if `-t <some target>` was additionally specified.

title: script: Capitalize target defines again
body: I think that fixes a regression introduced with the new feature-set. Feel free to deny or request changes.

title: Automatically deploy release binaries from Travis
body: With this patch, Travis build release binaries for Linux and two recent CentOS versions (to precisely match the target libc) for every tag and attaches them as asset to a release on GitHub, see [this example](https://github.com/fabianschuiki/bender/releases/tag/ci-test).

title: script: Fix two bugs with target defines
sources: Enable flattened and pretty print source listings
Let user resolve dependency conflicts (#2)
body:
Let's get #2 implemented.

- [x] Let the user interactively resolve dependency conflicts as described in #2.
- [x] Impose manually selected revision for that dependency on *all* packages. Currently the user query is repeated for every conflicting package.
- [x] Maintain old behavior if `stdin` is not open.
- [x] Properly handle I/O and parsing problems; return descriptive errors, repeat input, or return the original error  (lots of dirty `unwrap`s at the moment).
